page.title: 18Crosland Moor Airfield
page.content: The Airfield at Crosland Moor was built in 1946 as a private airfield for local tractor manufacturer David Brown. The airfield is now used by private planes belonging to businessmen and by people who want to learn how to fly for fun. Up to twelve planes use the airfield each day along with eight other planes that visit it. The planes are four seater light aircraft. The busiest day of the week is Sunday because people come for their flying lessons. It costs Â£50 an hour to learn to fly and takes about 43 hours to gain a pilot's licence. There have been two crashes at the airfield but no_one has been seriously injured.
